-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Allows a listener to be associated to a client side post back
The current control on the page or the page itself. Depending on where the page is in its lifecycle it may not be possible to add a control directly to the page object, therefore we will use the current control being rendered to append the postback control. Name of the event to sync. If a page contains more than a single client side event only the events associated with the passed in name will be raised. Server side AddressOf the function to handle the event Boolean flag to determine if multiple event handlers can be associated to an event.
[Jon Henning] 9/15/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Registers a button inside a table for the ability to perform client-side reordering
Button responsible for moving the row up or down. Page the table belongs to. Can't just use objButton.Page because inside ItemCreated event of grid the button has no page yet. Determines if the button is responsible for moving the row up or down Unique key for the table/grid to be used to obtain the new order on postback. Needed when calling GetClientSideReOrder
[Jon Henning] 3/10/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieves an array of the new order for the rows
Unique key for the table/grid to be used to obtain the new order on postback. Needed when calling GetClientSideReOrder Page the table belongs to. Can't just use objButton.Page because inside ItemCreated event of grid the button has no page yet.
[Jon Henning] 3/10/2006 Created

----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : DotNetNuke Class : ClientAPIPostBackControl
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Control used to register post-back events
In order for a post-back event to be trapped we need to associate a control to handle the event.
[Jon Henning] 9/15/2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Searches control hierarchy from top down to find a control matching the passed in name
Root control to begin searching Name of control to look for
This differs from FindControlRecursive in that it looks down the control hierarchy, whereas, the FindControlRecursive starts at the passed in control and walks the tree up. Therefore, this function is more a expensive task.
[Jon Henning] 9/17/2004 Created [Jon Henning] 12/3/2004 Now checking if the control HasControls before calling FindControl. Using FindControl or accessing the controls collection on controls like the DataList can cause problems with ViewState
